instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
Hi Repair People.

I'm new here and would appreciate your help. I'm working on an Air 820-00165-a liquid damaged which i managed to power on. Had damange near SMC, battery controller tps 625, 51980a and few other places. Contacts renewed everywhere that needed. The issue is that when i have the battery and charger plugged in not powering on or if i power on on charger and then plug in the battery it turns off the adapter completely. Also i replaced the charging controller which i took out from an old board for parts. Any advice please? THANKS :D

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
Post exact voltage for PPBUS_G3H (F7140) on charger only, without battery connected.
Also the exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7100 (ohm scale); remove any power first!
You could have shorted D-S Q7130, or/and Q7155.

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
Hi [B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL][/B]

17/18 and 27/28 full short
Voltage on F7140 13.99v
No shorts on Q7130 and q7155

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
"17/18 and 27/28 full short"
Impossible!
Please post EXACT value on ohm scale.

"Voltage on F7140 13.99v
No shorts on Q7130"
Are you sure Q7130 is not shorted D-S on high side?
I mean between pins 9-10 (2-10) in schematic, for example...

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
You're right q7130 is shorted  between pins 9-10
Resistance on U7100 17/18 pin is 0 ohms & 27/28 0 ohms

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
"Resistance on U7100 17/18 pin is 0 ohms & 27/28 0 ohms"
Still impossible!
Look at schematic and guess the values; aprox 2 and 20 ohms respectively...

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
You're right, but my multimeter is playing with me :o

27/28 is 20.7 ohms
17/18 is 3.5/3.6 ohms

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
OK, that's good; I mean the values, not the multimeter.

Machine works good after Q7130 changed?

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message: Your issue is the charger circuit as 2informaticos said. Replace the ISL6259, Q7130, and Q7155 all at the same time and comment

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message: PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR and CHGR_PHASE on q7130 are shorted i replaced isl6259 and q7155 but i need to find from another board q7130

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message: Did you power it up? If so, must replace both again. Do not power up until all 3 are replaced at the same time

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message: yes i did hahah looking for parts now :D

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
Missing Q7130 will not burn anything if you power up the board.
However, is no reason to do that...

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
Update: 
C7125 was damaged i replaced it and on contact 2 of it the line was broken CHGR_PHASE so i rewired and now powering on only on battery :p

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message: ok so... found some more damaged around SMC made the connections to make sure all good and replaced  Q7130. When laptop plugged in shows green light and orange no power on, but soon as i plug in the battery powers on right away and if i unplug the battery turns off and light stays on.

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
F7140 voltage on charger only?
Be sure to have good traces for C7125.

threads.title: 820-00165-a
threads.message:
F7140 is 3.6v when only on charger 
CHGR_ACIN was 3.6v only on charger , once battery plugged in power on and jumps to 3.9 and i think it should be 4.8 calculated by the resistance on 7110 and 7111.
I fixed the trace for CHGR_PHASE from C7125 powering on now and charging atm hope will be good. One thing now is that the CPU is overheating :D
